meanings.definition: A person or thing that sheets.
meanings.sent1: The sheeters in the office always make sure the papers are neatly organized.
meanings.sent2: The sheeters at the factory are responsible for stacking the freshly printed sheets.
meanings.sent3: The sheeters at the party were the ones folding the napkins into intricate shapes.
meanings.sent4: She was like a sheeters, carefully layering each sheet of pastry to create a delicious dessert.
meanings.sent5: The sheeters in the library diligently filed away the documents in their proper places.

meanings.definition: A machine that cuts or shapes sheets of material.
meanings.sent1: The sheeters in the workshop are used to cut large pieces of fabric.
meanings.sent2: The bakery invested in a new sheeters to streamline their pastry production.
meanings.sent3: The sheeters in the factory hummed as they sliced through the metal sheets effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: The sheeters roared to life, transforming the flat dough into perfectly shaped pasta sheets.
meanings.sent5: The sheeters in the print shop worked tirelessly to create precise cuts in the paper sheets.

meanings.definition: A tool used for smoothing or spreading sheets of material.
meanings.sent1: The painter used a sheeters to evenly spread the plaster on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The chef's favorite sheeters helped him spread the icing smoothly on the cake.
meanings.sent3: The sheeters in the art class were essential for blending colors on the canvas.
meanings.sent4: Her hands moved like a sheeters, effortlessly smoothing out the wrinkles in the fabric.
meanings.sent5: The sheeters in the workshop were indispensable for ensuring a uniform layer of paint on the surface.
